intro: Stillingia velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf stillingia, is a perennial shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by dark, spherical berries. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests. Botanically, it belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms.
